content:
ToolStripSplitButton Class

In this Article

Represents a combination of a standard button on the left and a drop-down button on the right, or the other way around if the value of RightToLeft is Yes.

Syntax

Declaration

[System.ComponentModel.DefaultEvent("ButtonClick")]
[System.Windows.Forms.Design.ToolStripItemDesignerAvailability(System.Windows.Forms.Design.ToolStripItemDesignerAvailability.ToolStrip | System.Windows.Forms.Design.ToolStripItemDesignerAvailability.StatusStrip)]
public class ToolStripSplitButton : System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownItem

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • MarshalByRefObject
  • Component
  • ToolStripItem
  • System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownItem
  • ToolStripSplitButton

Remarks

ToolStripSplitButton combines button and drop-down button functionality.

Use the DefaultItem property to synchronize the Click event of the chosen drop-down item with the item shown on the button.

Constructors summary

ToolStripSplitButton()

Initializes a new instance of the ToolStripSplitButton class.
ToolStripSplitButton(Image)

Initializes a new instance of the ToolStripSplitButton class with the specified image.
ToolStripSplitButton(String)

Initializes a new instance of the ToolStripSplitButton class with the specified text.
ToolStripSplitButton(String,Image)

Initializes a new instance of the ToolStripSplitButton class with the specified text and image.
ToolStripSplitButton(String,Image,EventHandler)

Initializes a new instance of the ToolStripSplitButton class with the specified display text, image, and Click event handler.
ToolStripSplitButton(String,Image,ToolStripItem[])

Initializes a new instance of the ToolStripSplitButton class with the specified text, image, and ToolStripItem array.
ToolStripSplitButton(String,Image,EventHandler,String)

Initializes a new instance of the ToolStripSplitButton class with the specified display text, image, Click event handler, and name.

Properties summary

AutoToolTip

Gets or sets a value indicating whether default or custom ToolTip text is displayed on the ToolStripSplitButton.
ButtonBounds

Gets the size and location of the standard button portion of a ToolStripSplitButton.
ButtonPressed

Gets a value indicating whether the button portion of the ToolStripSplitButton is in the pressed state.
ButtonSelected

Gets a value indicating whether the standard button portion of a ToolStripSplitButton is selected or the stem.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSplitButton.DropDownButtonPressed* property is true.
DefaultAutoToolTip

Gets a value indicating whether to display the ToolTip that is defined as the default.
DefaultItem

Gets or sets the portion of the ToolStripSplitButton that is activated when the control is first selected.
DismissWhenClicked

Gets a value indicating whether items on a ToolStripSplitButton are hidden after they are clicked.
DropDownButtonBounds

Gets the size and location, in screen coordinates, of the drop-down button portion of a ToolStripSplitButton.
DropDownButtonPressed

Gets a value indicating whether the drop-down portion of the ToolStripSplitButton is in the pressed state.
DropDownButtonSelected

Gets a value indicating whether the drop-down button portion of a ToolStripSplitButton is selected.
DropDownButtonWidth

The width, in pixels, of the drop-down button portion of a ToolStripSplitButton.
SplitterBounds

Gets the boundaries of the separator between the standard and drop-down button portions of a ToolStripSplitButton.

CreateAccessibilityInstance()

Creates a new accessibility object for the ToolStripSplitButton.
CreateDefaultDropDown()

Creates a generic ToolStripDropDown for which events can be defined.

Retrieves the size of a rectangular area into which a ToolStripSplitButton can be fitted.
OnButtonClick(EventArgs)

Raises the ButtonClick event.
OnButtonDoubleClick(EventArgs)

Raises the ButtonDoubleClick event.
OnDefaultItemChanged(EventArgs)

Raises the DefaultItemChanged event.
OnMouseDown(MouseEventArgs)

Raises the MouseDown event.
OnMouseLeave(EventArgs)

Raises the MouseLeave event.
OnMouseUp(MouseEventArgs)

Raises the MouseUp event.
OnPaint(PaintEventArgs)

Raises the Paint event.
OnRightToLeftChanged(EventArgs)

Raises the RightToLeftChanged event.
PerformButtonClick()

If the stem.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem.Enabled* property is true, calls the stem.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSplitButton.OnButtonClick* method.
ProcessDialogKey(Keys)

Processes a dialog key.
ProcessMnemonic(Char)

Processes a mnemonic character.
ResetDropDownButtonWidth()

This method is not relevant to this class.

Events summary

ButtonClick

Occurs when the standard button portion of a ToolStripSplitButton is clicked.
ButtonDoubleClick

Occurs when the standard button portion of a ToolStripSplitButton is double-clicked.
DefaultItemChanged

Occurs when the stem.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSplitButton.DefaultItem* has changed.

      The text to be displayed on the ToolStripSplitButton.

      Raises the Click event when the user clicks the ToolStripSplitButton.

  • ToolStripSplitButton(String,Image,EventHandler,String)

    Initializes a new instance of the ToolStripSplitButton class with the specified display text, image, Click event handler, and name.

    public ToolStripSplitButton (string text, System.Drawing.Image image, EventHandler onClick, string name);

    Parameters

    • text
      String

      The text to be displayed on the ToolStripSplitButton.

    • image
      Image

      The Image to be displayed on the ToolStripSplitButton.

    • onClick
      EventHandler

      Raises the Click event when the user clicks the ToolStripSplitButton.

    • name
      String

      The name of the ToolStripSplitButton.

Properties

  • AutoToolTip

    Gets or sets a value indicating whether default or custom ToolTip text is displayed on the ToolStripSplitButton.

    public bool AutoToolTip { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if default ToolTip text is displayed; otherwise, false. The default is true.

    Remarks

    Set the AutoToolTip property to false to display custom text on a ToolStripSplitButton.

  • ButtonBounds

    Gets the size and location of the standard button portion of a ToolStripSplitButton.

    public System.Drawing.Rectangle ButtonBounds { get; }

    Property Value

    • Rectangle

      A Rectangle that represents the size and location of the standard button portion of a ToolStripSplitButton.

  • ButtonPressed

    Gets a value indicating whether the button portion of the ToolStripSplitButton is in the pressed state.

    public bool ButtonPressed { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the button portion of the ToolStripSplitButton is in the pressed state; otherwise, false.

  • ButtonSelected

    Gets a value indicating whether the standard button portion of a ToolStripSplitButton is selected or the stem.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSplitButton.DropDownButtonPressed* property is true.

    public bool ButtonSelected { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the button portion of a ToolStripSplitButton is selected or whether stem.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSplitButton.DropDownButtonPressed* is true; otherwise, false.

  • DefaultAutoToolTip

    Gets a value indicating whether to display the ToolTip that is defined as the default.

    protected override bool DefaultAutoToolTip { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true in all cases.

  • DefaultItem

    Gets or sets the portion of the ToolStripSplitButton that is activated when the control is first selected.

    public System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem DefaultItem { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • ToolStripItem

      A Forms.ToolStripItem representing the portion of the ToolStripSplitButton that is activated when first selected. The default value is null.

    Remarks

    If a ToolStripSplitButton has a DefaultItem, the ENTER key activates the button. Otherwise, the ENTER key activates the drop-down.

    Use the DefaultItem property to synchronize the Click event of the chosen drop-down item with the item shown on the button.

  • DismissWhenClicked

    Gets a value indicating whether items on a ToolStripSplitButton are hidden after they are clicked.

    protected override bool DismissWhenClicked { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the items are hidden after they are clicked; otherwise, false.

  • DropDownButtonBounds

    Gets the size and location, in screen coordinates, of the drop-down button portion of a ToolStripSplitButton.

    public System.Drawing.Rectangle DropDownButtonBounds { get; }

    Property Value

    • Rectangle

      A Rectangle that represents the size and location of the drop-down button portion of a ToolStripSplitButton, in screen coordinates.

  • DropDownButtonPressed

    Gets a value indicating whether the drop-down portion of the ToolStripSplitButton is in the pressed state.

    public bool DropDownButtonPressed { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the drop-down portion of the ToolStripSplitButton is in the pressed state; otherwise, false.

  • DropDownButtonSelected

    Gets a value indicating whether the drop-down button portion of a ToolStripSplitButton is selected.

    public bool DropDownButtonSelected { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the drop-down button portion of a ToolStripSplitButton is selected; otherwise, false.

  • DropDownButtonWidth

    The width, in pixels, of the drop-down button portion of a ToolStripSplitButton.

    public int DropDownButtonWidth { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      An Int32 representing the width in pixels. The default is 11. Starting with the .NET Framework 4.6, the default value is based on the DPI setting of the device running the app.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentOutOfRangeException

      The specified value is less than zero (0).

  • SplitterBounds

    Gets the boundaries of the separator between the standard and drop-down button portions of a ToolStripSplitButton.

    public System.Drawing.Rectangle SplitterBounds { get; }

    Property Value

    • Rectangle

      A Rectangle that represents the size and location of the separator.

    Remarks

    Use the SplitterBounds property to do custom painting.

  • OnButtonClick(EventArgs)

    Raises the ButtonClick event.

    protected virtual void OnButtonClick (EventArgs e);

    Parameters

    • e
      EventArgs

      An EventArgs that contains the event data.

    Remarks

    Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate. For more information, see Events.

    The OnButtonClick method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

  • PerformButtonClick()

    If the stem.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem.Enabled* property is true, calls the stem.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSplitButton.OnButtonClick* method.

    public void PerformButtonClick ();
  • ProcessDialogKey(Keys)

    Processes a dialog key.

    protected override bool ProcessDialogKey (System.Windows.Forms.Keys keyData);

    Parameters

    • keyData
      Keys

      One of the Keys values that represents the key to process.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the key was processed by the item; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    This method is called during message preprocessing to handle the ENTER and SPACEBAR keys in order to raise the Click event. However, if the ToolStripSplitButton is not enabled, this method calls the base class implementation instead.

    This method is called only if the IsInputKey method indicates that the item is not processing the key.

  • ProcessMnemonic(Char)

    protected override bool ProcessMnemonic (char charCode);

    Parameters

    Returns

      true in all cases.

Events

  • ButtonClick

    Occurs when the standard button portion of a ToolStripSplitButton is clicked.

    public event EventHandler ButtonClick;

    Remarks

    For more information about handling events, see Events.

    Example

    The following code example demonstrates the use of this member. In the example, an event handler reports on the occurrence of the ButtonClick event. This report helps you to learn when the event occurs and can assist you in debugging. To report on multiple events or on events that occur frequently, consider replacing Show with WriteLine or appending the message to a multiline TextBox.

    To run the example code, paste it into a project that contains an instance of type ToolStripSplitButton named ToolStripSplitButton1. Then ensure that the event handler is associated with the ButtonClick event. 

    private void ToolStripSplitButton1_ButtonClick(Object sender, EventArgs e) {

   MessageBox.Show("You are in the ToolStripSplitButton.ButtonClick event.");

}

    Private Sub ToolStripSplitButton1_ButtonClick(sender as Object, e as EventArgs) _ 
     Handles ToolStripSplitButton1.ButtonClick

   MessageBox.Show("You are in the ToolStripSplitButton.ButtonClick event.")

End Sub
